list_definition.definition: to (chew and) swallow; to take food

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They are forbidden to eat meat
They ate up all the cakes
She was eating a chocolate biscuit.

list_ex_of_english: They might be eating, talking, whistling, humming, smoking during the most dramatic scenes.
In different countries, the same species can be prepared for eating in different ways which require different chemotypes.

Latent structure of eating disorder symptoms : a factor analytic and taxometric investigation.
She reported eating all sorts of things she should not have.
Special offers of ready-to-eat food were one way of reducing their own work, as seen by single-living and the oldest women.
For example, whenever they were hungry they ate together.
They had been advised to eat one pound of red meat per day and avoid carbohydrate-rich food.
